articles.description: Chelsea overcome Ajax 4-1 on aggregate to earn a place in the Women's Champions League semi-finals, plus all the latest football news and gossip.
articles.title: Latest football news and Women's Champions League reaction

articles.description: The Golden State Warriors overcome Draymond Green's early ejection to claim a 101-93 win against the Orlando Magic.
articles.title: NBA: Golden State Warriors overcome early Draymond Green ejection to beat Orlando Magic

articles.description: The Enhanced Games has been derided as "a clown show" and "borderline criminal". But their founder and his backers believe in a future few have foreseen.
articles.title: The mind behind the 'doped Olympics'

articles.description: Australian Open champion Jannik Sinner moves into the Miami semi-finals by ending Czech opponent Tomas Machac's stunning run.
articles.title: Miami Open: Jannik Sinner beats Tomas Machac to reach semi-finals

articles.description: Sunrisers Hyderabad smash 277-3 - the highest total in Indian Premier League history - in a 31-run victory against Mumbai Indians.
articles.title: Sunrisers hit highest total in IPL history

articles.description: Victoria Azarenka will face Kazakhstan's Elena Rybakina in the Miami Open semi-finals, while Danielle Collins will play Ekaterina Alexandrova.
articles.title: Miami Open: Victoria Azarenka sets up semi-final with Elena Rybakina, Danielle Collins through

articles.description: British elite sportswomen tell BBC Sport about their experiences of disordered eating and ask what an athlete is 'supposed' to look like.
articles.title: 'Guilty' and 'obsessive' - sportswomen on disordered eating

articles.description: Listen to BBC Radio 5 Live and follow live text updates as Chelsea face Ajax in the Women's Champions League quarter-final second leg at Stamford Bridge.
articles.title: Women's Champions League: Chelsea host Ajax in quarter-final second leg

articles.description: BBC Sport looks at Declan Rice's impact at Arsenal as they prepare to meet title rivals Manchester City.
articles.title: How Rice has improved title-chasing Arsenal

articles.description: Spain's ex-football boss could go to prison because of a non-consensual kiss at the Women's World Cup.
articles.title: Luis Rubiales: Prosecutors want jail for World Cup kiss
